entries.title: The Comparative Difficulty of Testing and Coding
entries.text: Coding and testing. Opposite, yet fundamentally inter-related. Like the Yin and the Yang. Like a pain in the neck and a pain in the-- err, yes, you get the idea. chromatic discusses the healthy equilibrium between those two sides of development.

entries.title: Design by contract in Perl
entries.text: vti reviews the 'Design By Contract' CPAN modules, and ultimately comes up with a new contender.

entries.title: More Mojolicious ConsoleLogger
entries.text: A new version of Mojolicious::Plugin::ConsoleLogger is out, providing new helpful debugging features like an easy access to the config, session ans stash information of the application.

entries.title: Deploying a Catalyst application with Starman and Apache on Linux
entries.text: Exactly what it says on the tin. Nitish Bezzala shares a quick recipe on how to have a Catalyst application running on CentOS, using Starman and Apache.

chapters.title: Slides
entries.title: Merry Slidemas!
entries.text: Matt S Trout shares with us all a slide-dump of his laptop, as well as a TCL script (complete with annotations) to clean up their formatting.

chapters.title: Events
chapters.header: I usually list the next 3-4 events here. The list of all the events can be found on the web site. If your Perl event is not listed there, please let me know.
